content: <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>NOAA National Marine Fisheries Service</origin>         <pubdate>20080902</pubdate>         <title>Green Turtle Critical Habitat</title>         <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>         <onlink>http://sero.nmfs.noaa.gov/maps_gis_data/protected_resources/critical_habitat/index.html</onlink>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract>These data represent the critical habitat for green turtle as designated by Federal Register Vol. 63, No. 46701, September 2, 1998, Rules and Regulations.</abstract>       <purpose>The purpose of these data is to visually represent the critical habitat areas for GIS analysis and display.</purpose>     </descript>     <timeperd>       <timeinfo>         <sngdate>           <caldate>19980902</caldate>         </sngdate>       </timeinfo>       <current>ground condition</current>     </timeperd>     <status>       <progress>Complete</progress>       <update>As needed</update>     </status>     <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc>-65.394622</westbc>         <eastbc>-65.193776</eastbc>         <northbc>18.398328</northbc>         <southbc>18.228990</southbc>       </bounding>     </spdom>     <keywords>       <theme>         <themekt>None</themekt>         <themekey>GIS</themekey>         <themekey>Endangered Species</themekey>         <themekey>Green Sea Turtle</themekey>         <themekey>Chelonia mydas</themekey>         <themekey>Critical Habitat</themekey>       </theme>       <theme>         <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Categories</themekt>         <themekey>biota</themekey>         <themekey>boundaries</themekey>         <themekey>environment</themekey>         <themekey>oceans</themekey>       </theme>       <place>         <placekt>None</placekt>         <placekey>Las Hermanas</placekey>         <placekey>Puerto Rico</placekey>         <placekey>Cayo Lobito</placekey>         <placekey>Los Gemelos</placekey>         <placekey>Cayo Ballena</placekey>         <placekey>Alcarraza</placekey>         <placekey>Isla Culebrita</placekey>         <placekey>Cayo Lobo</placekey>         <placekey>Cayo Norte</placekey>         <placekey>Culebra Island</placekey>         <placekey>El Mono</placekey>         <placekey>Arrecife Culebrita</placekey>         <placekey>Cayos Geniqui</placekey>         <placekey>Cayo de Luis Pena</placekey>         <placekey>Piedra Steven</placekey>         <placekey>Caribbean</placekey>         <placekey>Cayo Botijuela</placekey>       </place>     </keywords>     <accconst>None</accconst>     <useconst>Users be advised that the accuracy of this data set is completely dependent upon the accuracy of the shoreline data used in the creation process. For more details on this process, see the process description. The text description in 63 FR 46701 is always the one, true definition of green turtle critical habitat. These or any other depictions are for information purposes only and shouldn't be relied on for regulatory purposes.</useconst>     <ptcontac>       <cntinfo>         <cntorgp>           <cntorg>NOAA-National Marine Fisheries Service</cntorg>           <cntper>Jennifer Moore</cntper>         </cntorgp>         <cntpos>Natural Resource Specialist</cntpos>         <cntaddr>           <addrtype>mailing and physical</addrtype>           <address>263 13th Avenue South</address>           <city>St. Petersburg</city>           <state>FL</state>           <postal>33071</postal>           <country>US</country>         </cntaddr>         <cntvoice>727-824-5312</cntvoice>         <cntfax>727-824-5309</cntfax>         <cntemail>Jennifer.Moore@noaa.gov</cntemail>         <hours>Monday - Friday, 8:00am - 5:00pm</hours>       </cntinfo>     </ptcontac>     <native>Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143</native>     <crossref>       <citeinfo>         <title>NOAA Navigation Chart 25653</title>       </citeinfo>     </crossref>   </idinfo>   <dataqual>     <logic>Not Applicable</logic>     <complete>Complete Pending NMFS PRD Review</complete>     <posacc>       <horizpa>         <qhorizpa>           <horizpae>NOAA Navigation Chart 25653 (Scale= 1:20,000)</horizpae>         </qhorizpa>       </horizpa>     </posacc>     <lineage>       <srcinfo>         <srccite>           <citeinfo>             <origin>NOAA NOS</origin>             <title>NOAA Navigational Chart 25653</title>           </citeinfo>         </srccite>         <typesrc>hardcopy</typesrc>         <srccitea>NOAA Navigational Chart 25653</srccitea>       </srcinfo>       <procstep>         <procdesc>FR 46699 Vol. 63 No 1700 Sept 2, 1998 was reinterpretted and there is a map in the FR which shows that the islands weren't buffered, only Isla de Culebra. Projected base data to WGS-Mercator (units=meters), and buffered to 5.6 km. This buffer does not look like the FR, as it bisects Cayo Lobito. Then the data was reprojected to GCS-WGS84.</procdesc>       </procstep>       <procstep>         <procdesc>Land area was erased from the buffer area using ET Geowizards. The source of land area used to erase was from the NCCOS project for coral and seafloor mapping.</procdesc>         <srcused>Q:\\ARCDATA\\GEODATA\\States\\PRVI\\shoreln_prvi_NCCOS_po</srcused>       </procstep>       <procstep>         <procdesc>Detailed shoreline for Culebra Island from NOAA digital vector chart was appended to add smaller islands, then a 3 nautical mile buffer was generated using ESRI's ArcGIS software.</procdesc>         <srcused>Fish and Wildlife Service (FWS), Department of the Interior and National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Department of Commerce - Endangered and Threatened Wildlife and Plants; Designation of Critical Habitat for the green turtle, [63 FR 46701]</srcused>
